featured.text: It consists of a piece of rubber, plastic, leather, or woven material in the outline of a foot, with a strap holding the sandal to a wearer’s toes.
In the Greek version, the toe strap ran between the first and second toes, while Roman sandals had the strap between the second and third toes.
Modern flip-flops derive from Japanese zōris, which were often worn with socks dividing the big toe from the rest, and were typically made of rice straw.
In India, “toe knob” sandals had a knob between the first and second toes.

other.text: Which of the following is true about the modern development of the flip-flop? (A) Modern flip-flops originated from Indian toe knob sandals.
The straps on the heel and toe control the length of the shoe, 25 the two on either side allow for different widths.
The Mesopotamians wore the strap between the third and fourth toes.

definition.zh_def: 腳趾，指的是人或動物的腳部末端的部分。
definition.en_def: A toe is one of the digits of the foot, typically found at the end of the foot.
definition.example: She stubbed her toe on the furniture.
